results.title: Free play and music
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “The Kindergarten child series”.
Children are encouraged to select toys or materials which interest them, each child directing his own activity with the objects. Music periods involve singing accompanied by physical participation.

results.title: Do you know how to make purple?
results.creator_credit: D. Keith Carlson and Education Division WGBH
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Kindergarten child series”.
Children in a kindergarten are viewed painting at their easels, some working together, others working alone.

results.title: Discussion
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Kindergarten child series”.
Intending to stimulate language development and curiosity, and enlargement of concepts, understanding, the teacher introduces some human vertebrae and discusses their relation to the human form, allowing the children to handle the bones. For preschool eduction.

results.title: Did you forget I'm five?
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “The Kindergarten child series”.
Begins with a discussion of general interest to the children - the origin and structure of corn on the cob, related activities including the preparation and cooking of corn follow.

results.title: A Child
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Kindergarten child series”.
Illustrates the importance of a teacher’s observation of individual behaviour in the classroom situation. An indecisive child is directed to pursue an activity through one-to-one contact with the teacher.

results.title: The Art teacher has nine kittens
results.creator_credit: D. Keith Carlson and Educational Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “The Kindergarten child series”.
A basket of kittens serves as a vehicle for experiences in classifying, counting, and colour recognition, and extends an understanding of the birth and care of young animals for a kindergarten class.

results.title: Planning metrication
results.creator_credit: Stanley Marks, Stephen Cross and New Decade Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Keys to Metrication”.
The success of metrication depends on careful planning to keep companies in step with their suppliers and customers, and to keep company departments in step with one another. How to start and organise the changeover, aspects of phasing, control and costs, staff familiarisation and training; the importance of timing and of using the opportunity for rationalisation which metrication offers to large and small concerns.

results.title: Phasing in metric designs
results.creator_credit: Stanley Marks, Stephen Cross, New Decade Productions and Central Office of Information
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Keys to Metrication”.
The changeover to metric design will normally be gradual and needs careful preparation. Imperial past can be incorporated in a metric environment of vice versa.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Stanley Marks, Stephen Cross, New Decade Productions and Central Office of Information
